tweets.text: In the Chamber today for DEFRA questions. It's been a remarkable few weeks for @DefraGovUK with both the #AgricultureBill and #FisheriesBill receiving Royal Assent and the #EnvironmentBill in Committee @VictoriaPrentis @ZacGoldsmith https://t.co/P2pWx2OuDa

Turner & Townsend have organised  some really interesting Carbon & Energy Management training today for some of its staff who are servicing the @EnvAgency, one of our Key Clients.  Thanks to @GEPEnv for delivering the training.@turnertownsend https://t.co/2UFIwayW4T

The majority of Earth's chalk streams & rivers are found in England; fragile, extraordinary ecologies.
But they're dying from water company over-extraction, pollution & @EnvAgency inaction.
@Feargal_Sharkey is leading an event (8 Dec) on stopping the rot.
https://t.co/znRcXVS58x

Did you know that the #Kendal Flood Risk Management Scheme will improve many different habitats. 

Newly created habitats will increase species and woodland planting will provide cover for otters & foraging opportunities for birds & bats. 

More ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/XTYr7iYCo9

tweets.text:
Works are progressing well as part of Phase 2 of the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme. 

Our schemes take into account #Biodiversity & this week we have installed new bat boxes to the rear of the Sands Centre

For more info https://t.co/gxCTOEbsAK https://t.co/2Ed6lqjVTf

It's little things that make our collective efforts worthwhile.
Spur us on to achieve more.
An Otter in the Irwell at Adelphi in the centre of Salford
HOW AMAZING IS THAT
@salford_mayor @salforduni @SalfordVRangers @natural_course @EnvAgencyNW @MarkSewellUU @GroundworkGM https://t.co/zOfdnhY7DJ

urls.title: Leading the way in environmental consultancy in Ireland | APEM
urls.description: Thank you for registering to receive updates. Specialising in terrestrial, freshwater and marine ecology, laboratory services and digital aerial surveys we support clients in Ireland and from across the world, to meet their environmental and green aspirations and regulatory requirements. From algal bloom management through to water quality monitoring, 3D aerial modelling to protected species surveys, environmental impact assessment to marine ornithology, we deliver an extensive range of services, delivered

@markrwilliamson @SmartGrowthUK Water companies will always claim to be able to meet demand from new developments because it grows their customer base.
